name: Hotel du Vin Cheltenham

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here on the Sunday night £10 deal where you have to spend £75 in the restaurant or bar to get the room for £10.
reviews.title: A perfect get away

reviews.text: The hotel was fantastic - the bar is really impressive with a gorgeous chandelier made of wine glasses and a sweeping staircase leading down to the restaurant.
reviews.title: Lovely room and service but the food should be better

reviews.text: The food was delicious and the staff are very knowledgeable about the food and wine list.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel with great food&wine to match!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is a short walk away from the city centre and we had no problems parking in the additional car parking area at the back of the hotel.
reviews.title: Enjoyed my stay but will not come again due to value for money overall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bedroom was spacious, warm, comfortable and very tastefully decorated. We had such a great night's sleep and there are lots of lovely toileteries to take away.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, shame about the service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed on their Sunday deal - spend £75 in the bar/bistro and stay for £10. We had a lovely room. Very contemporary, great heated floor in the bathroom and lovely full size Arran Aromatics to take away. The bed was huge and very very comfy - we loved the pillows. The quality was excellent. We ate in the Bistro on the Sunday night and it was divine - overall, an excellent stay and excellent value for money. the location is perfect for the town centre and we never had any problems parking.
reviews.title: Just Excellent!

reviews.text: I visited the hotel for a short relaxing break, and the hotel did the job superbly. The room was spacious with excellent fabrics and fittings, a big comfy bed and a stand-alone bath in the room. The bathroom had the best 'monsoon' shower I've ever used.
reviews.title: Wonderful Relaxing Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Contrary to previous reviews I found the parking fine - I always managed to get one of the limited spaces at the front, but from my room I could see the rear car park always had plenty of space.
reviews.title: Haven't eaten out SO well in years..

reviews.text: The hotel is a bit further from the city centre than some - an easy 5-10 minute walk - but is nicely situated in a Regency residential area - albeit most of the houses are now offices. As ever with HduV the food was superb - but the internet access was expensive and 'medium' speed at best.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel - superb food and bedrooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Didn't stay at the hotel.just ate in their Restaurant.. We recommend the 35 GBP meal for two plus wine voucher offer ..
reviews.title: Nice place to chill for a few days
Nothing amazing, nothing terrible
reviews.text: We stayed for a night at the Hotel du Vin. The room was smallish and at a subterranean level so there wasn't much natural light. I was expecting something a little bit more unique but there wasn't much to distinguish the room from other chain hotels. The guy at reception was completely OTT in his service style, like a gameshow host or a butlins red coat! The breakfast was excellent and plentiful. We passed by the Montpellier Chapter for a nose around and wish we had stayed there.

reviews.title: Wow! Loved this hotel.
reviews.text: Brilliant rooms with cracking bathroom. Had 4 showers & 1 shared bath in 18 hrs.

reviews.title: Good hotel
reviews.text: The hotel in really swanky with really tentative staff who made us feel welcome right from the start until we left.

reviews.title: Almost perfect
reviews.text: The best breakfast I've had in a long time. Eggs benadict. mmmmmm.

reviews.title: Excellent service, brilliant staff, good food and great wine
reviews.text: Location on a slightly busy road but could spin that to a positive for people watching.

reviews.title: Good Hotel, big parking problems
reviews.text: This is a fine hotel, similar to other HdV hotels located through the UK.

reviews.title: Watch the charges!
reviews.text: The main positive features are a lively bar, very good bistro and the excellent staff in the spa.

reviews.title: Great!
reviews.text: The big draw back is that there is very little on site car parking, and no system to reserve that parking for hotel guests. Street parking nearby is very restricted. Staff were not much help, in that respect.

reviews.title: perfect overnight treat
reviews.text: The room is a fairly standard HdV room (which is quite a high standard for provincial England), good stand alone bath, decent bed, walk in shower and enough room. The TV was very small ( I wanted to watch the cup final !).

reviews.title: Welcoming, comfortable, centrally located
reviews.text: Though it was a while back it must go on the record. A couple of months after staying here I got a letter saying we had drunk a bottle of wine they had not charged for, and that they had charged it to my credit card. Their letter had no stamp so I was charged excess postage. I called and wrote to complain but got nowhere. For the price of a bottle of wine there was a limit to how hard I was prepared to fight it so I let it go. But will we go back? What do you think?

description: Formerly the Carlton Hotel and located in the chic Montpellier district of this historic spa town. Hotel du Vin Cheltenham offers forty nine bedrooms and suites, all decorated in inimitable Hotel du Vin style. The wonderfully spacious public areas centered around a showpiece spiral staircase, include a trademark Bistro with extensive al fresco dining, both a Champagne and Sinners Enclosure Bar, beauty treatment rooms and private dining rooms. The general manager is Tom Ross.
